title: Five poems with profound life lessons
text: Five poems with profound life lessons TNN | Feburary 17, 2017 1 /6 Five poems with profound life lessons They might read like simple poems, but carry life’s deepest lessons. These compositions by world’s greatest poets offer lessons untold. All Comments () Be the first one to review. We have sent you a verification email. To verify, just follow the link in the message 2 /6 PB Shelley’s Ode to the West Wind Though the poem allegorises the role of the poet as the voice of change and revolution, its deeper meaning lies in the positivity that it ends with...if winter comes, can spring be far behind! All Comments () Be the first one to review. We have sent you a verification email. To verify, just follow the link in the message 3 /6 Lamia by John Keats Lamia, a serpent in a human body is happily married to Lycious, till sage Apollonius reveals her true identity, destroying their world and killing Lycious who fails to recover from shock and grief. The poem questions the need for the revelation of bitter realities in words that have far reaching implications. All Comments ()
